#Text=Interview with recent Wikimedia Foundation board appointee Domas
#Text=Mituzas
#Text=Thursday , March 6 , 2008
#Text=This article mentions the Wikimedia Foundation , one of its projects , or people related to it .
#Text=Wikinews is a project of the Wikimedia Foundation .
#Text=Domas Mituzas is a Lithuanian software developer recently given a temporary position on the Wikimedia Foundation 's board .
#Text=The position lasts until June this year , after which he has stated he will decide whether he will run for a full term of two years .
#Text=As well as working for the Wikimedia Foundation , he is employed by MySQL AB .
#Text=In light of his recent appointment to the board , Wikinews conducted the following interview with Domas Mituzas .
#Text=Interview
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Congratulations on your new board position ! Can you tell us a bit about your background - previous work with the Foundation , what you do with MySQL AB etc ?
#Text=Domas Mituzas : Thanks !
#Text=Though my first edits to Wikipedia were in 2003 , I became actively involved in site technology back in 2004 .
#Text=Then I was working for a major IT company in the Baltic States , and was leading the systems group there .
#Text=Back then I could apply quite a bit of practice I had from my job to maintain Wikipedia in its technology infancy .
#Text=It became increasingly involving , and eventually the things we started doing became far more complex , especially when the exploding growth hit us .
#Text=Managing the growth and sustaining the site up was quite stressful at that time , and we started both lots of optimization and resource expansion work .
#Text=Eventually I got involved in the MySQL community , and was suggested to apply for a job in MySQL AB .
#Text=There I work in services division , assisting our customers with their problems , helping to grow their operations .
#Text=Now as part of company acquisition I 'm joining Sun Microsystems , and I 'm eager to see what possibilities can that provide .
#Text=Back in my childhood I was deep into encyclopedias , first dead tree ones , later CDs and online version of Britannica .
#Text=I had a dream , that once I get my own home , I 'll get full dead-tree version of Britannica on my bookshelves .
#Text=It did n't happen , as I got into Wikipedia the same year I bought my apartment .
#Text=Life is full of irony : - )
#Text=Actually , back in 2000

#Text=I approached university professor and tried to explain him a concept of dynamically edited news repository , where every concept could be explained deeper and deeper into elemental knowledge particles , and later that can be assembled in many dynamic ways .
#Text=His first question was " Is that some kind of website ?

#Text= , and I was angry at him for not getting the generic concept of knowledge at all .
